newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products mostly follow Brent futures down.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products mostly follow Brent futures down.

text.p: NWE oil products were mostly softer on Tuesday as Brent futures slipped.
Gas oil was weaker losing up to $1 a tonne on the back of easier futures which modest gains in premiums could not offset.
Gasoline was slightly weaker in a quiet market with Eurograde barges done at $199 fob ARA in late trade, against $200 earlier.
Naphtha was steady with perceptions of tight supply later this week following the continuing flow of material to the East.
High sulphur barges slipped to trade at $85 and $86 fob ARA. Low sulphur barges were offered around $98 with buyers at $96.
High and low sulphur cargoes were quiet.
